com.example.models

Interface Radio

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MyRadio

    public interface Radio

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeFrequency()
      Changes the frequency of the radio between AM/FM
      void changeStation(boolean up)
      changes tha station of the radio, represented by a double
      void changeStationButton(int numButton)
      sets the current station as the value of an specific saved station in the stations array
      boolean getFrequency()
      gets the actual frequency of the radio

      obtains the actual state of the radio (ON/OFF)

    • Method Detail

      • toggle

        void toggle()
        Changes the actual state of the radio between ON / OFF

      • getState

        boolean getState()
        obtains the actual state of the radio (ON/OFF)
        Returns:
        true for ON state, false for OFF state

      • changeFrequency

        void changeFrequency()
        Changes the frequency of the radio between AM/FM

      • changeStation

        void changeStation(boolean up)
        changes tha station of the radio, represented by a double
        Parameters:
        up - true to go to the next station, false to go to the previous station

      • getFrequency

        boolean getFrequency()
        gets the actual frequency of the radio
        Returns:
        a boolean to represent if radio is on AM/FM

      • saveStation

        void saveStation(int numButton)
        Saves the current station in the stations array
        Parameters:
        numButton - the position of the array where the station will be saved

      • changeStationButton

        void changeStationButton(int numButton)
        sets the current station as the value of an specific saved station in the stations array
        Parameters:
        numButton - the position of the array of the station to set as current station

      • getStation

        double getStation()
        get the current station of the radio
        Returns:
        the radios's current station, represented as a double
